summary: This document is an email chain from May 2021 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel and contractors discussing the technical review and production of discovery files for Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team. It details issues with file formats, uploads to the USAfx system, and plans to deliver files to Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case for whom discovery files are being prepared and reviewed. The emails discuss sending a disc of the production to her at the MDC.

events.title: Discovery File Review and Production Preparation
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office personnel and contractors review discovery files flagged by Maxwell's defense counsel for issues (blank, corrupt, missing, etc.) and prepare the production for sharing via USAfx and on disc.

events.title: Planned Delivery of Discovery to Maxwell
events.description: Plans are made to send the discovery production on a disc to Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY, 1 Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Epstein's compound (referenced in context of 3D scan files)
keyFacts: The prosecution was preparing discovery files for Ghislaine Maxwell's defense, encountering technical issues with file formats and uploads to the USAfx system.
A significant portion of the production consisted of non-PDF image files, raising concerns about Maxwell's ability to view them at the MDC.
The files included 'Lazer Scan' files, identified as 3D renderings and scans of Jeffrey Epstein's compound, which had been previously addressed in August/September 2020.
The email chain reveals logistical coordination between AUSAs, contractors, and paralegals to manage a large volume of discovery material (thousands of files) for a high-profile case.
The document is an internal administrative communication, highlighting the procedural aspects of discovery compliance in Maxwell's prosecution.
